description:
Full Job Description
Facebook Agile Silicon Team (FAST) focuses on delivering Facebook's vision through Augmented Reality (AR). Compute power requirements of Augmented Reality require custom silicon. FAST is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, machine learning, mixed reality, graphics, displays, and new ways to map the human body. Our chips will enable AR devices where our real and virtual world will mix and match throughout the day. We believe the only way to achieve our goals is to look at the entire stack, from transistor, through architecture to firmware and algorithms.FAST is looking for a Silicon Performance Architecture Intern who will work with a world-class group of engineers. The ideal candidate will understand the performance tradeoffs for various compute, memory and interconnect components in the context of heterogeneous systems with traditional CPU, GPU components and custom accelerators.
Carry out performance & power architecture exploration through detailed modeling and analysis of custom compute components, shared interconnect in a heterogeneous multi-agent system and/or shared cache/memory subsystem in a heterogeneous multi-agent system
Explore new methodologies to rapidly explore a vast design space from a performance/power standpoint
Understand the tradeoffs between general purpose and custom compute mechanisms
Understand the data flow paths, working set sizes, access patterns of different general purpose vs. custom compute components
QoS, latency and throughput analysis in heterogeneous platforms with multiple agents with competing resource requirements
Add support for measuring power in the model
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
1+ years experience in software design with C++
1+ years experience in performance modeling and architectural exploration methodologies
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Experience in tackling and solving challenging performance bottlenecks
Experience in the analysis and exploration of heterogeneous multi-agent platforms
Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Full Job Description

Corvid Technologies is seeking qualified candidates for an internship working with our Virtual Reality (VR) Visualization Development Group. The VR Visualization Development Group supports Corvid's Structural Mechanics Applications and Aerospace groups to create interactive VR visualizations of Finite Element and Computational Fluid Dynamics simulation results. The group develops data reduction methodologies and creates VR visualization software to view large-memory simulation datasets in a real-time immersive environment.

Examples of Desired Backgrounds: Engineering or Computer Science; background in 3D modeling software and familiarity with 3D geometry file formats; programming experience (Python, C++, C#, Javascript, or similar); knowledge of Unreal Engine 4 or Unity.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Full Job Description
US-IA-Des Moines

Req No. 2021-7301
Category Internship
Type Intern

The Opportunity

We are seeking a talented IT Quality Assurance Analyst Intern to carry out basic quality assurance processes; assist in developing test plans and test cases from functional specifications and business requirements, executing test cases, tracking software defects and verifying the software fixes. This includes unit, integration, system, regression and UAT. This role partners closely with other QA members, business analysts, software development and the stakeholders of the business. It is essential to ensuring on-time and on-budget delivery of new and enhanced business capabilities that meet or exceed expectations.

What You Can Look Forward to

Work closely with analysts, developers and engineers to assist writing test plans, estimates and schedules to support project and product releases.
Assist in developing Test Plans and test cases from Functional specifications and business requirements.
Executing Test Cases that follow best practice standards (manual) producing documented results that determine the release readiness of products or features.
Assist in troubleshooting of quality issues.
Actively Supports culture and leadership practices.
Proactively pursues development opportunities and show expected progress on learning plan.
Utilize templates, tools, metrics and best practices to verify that products meet business and user requirements.
Communicate consistently and effectively with internal business partners to understand appropriate business requirements.
Partners with business and IT to support testing for releases.
Ensure there is an understanding of work effort, timelines and expectations.
Actively supports our CO-OP culture and embraces our core values of Work as Partners, Communicate Openly and Honestly, Demonstrate Excellence and Champion Change in all interactions.

What You'll Need to Succeed

12 completed semester hours at college or university, preferably in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent.
3.0 Cumulative GPA.
Previous internship and/or work experience preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
The ability to work as part of a team demonstrated through involvement with student organizations, community involvement, work experience, or other activities.
Possess high motivation and self-direction, sound problem solving skills, decision making and multi- tasking skills.
Ability to think analytically to solve problems individually and in a team environment.
Ability to listen, understand, and respond to external and internal customers' needs in a timely manner.

Why Join CO-OP?

CO-OP is committed to fostering a workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and connected. We are dedicated to understanding, attracting and engaging a diverse workforce where every employee can live up to their pull potential; ensuring that our employee base reflects the consumers we serve. The result of this effort is an inclusive environment where diverse talent thrives. You will be part of an organization that focuses on a strong culture and embodies the credit union movement philosophy of People Helping People. CO-OP's commitment to reflecting our own core values and purpose extends beyond how we serve our clients and the products that we deliver.

With more than 35 years of industry leadership, CO-OP Financial Services is the largest, most comprehensive credit union service organization in the nation. CO-OP serves as THE credit union technology engine, bringing payments solutions, engagement services and strategic counsel to help credit unions optimize member experiences to consistently provide seamless, personalized multi-channel offerings, while delivering secure, sophisticated fraud mitigation service.

CO-OP serves more than 3,000 client credit unions, with 60 million debit and credit cardholders, nearly 30,000 surcharge-free ATMs and more than 5,600 shared branches nationwide. Our vast technological ecosystem facilitates more than 6.5 billion transactions every year and equips credit unions of all sizes to deepen member engagement and prosper in the fast-paced world of fintech.

The Perks

Fun, challenging and, collaborative work environment with passionate colleagues that care deeply about the intersection of technology and human-centered financial services.
Great Work/Life Benefits - Paid Time Off (PTO), Maternity, Parental, Family Care, Adoption Leave Programs, Community Volunteer Time Off, and 10 Paid Holidays.
Health benefits - medical, dental, & vision plus wellness programs and gym reimbursements.
401K with generous company match.
Tuition reimbursement.

Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 276903
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
We hire Strategic Product Management – Data & Analytics interns that are passionate about solving problems and impacting millions of end-users. We recognize that Intern contributions fuel some of our greatest innovations. That’s why we assign students to our toughest challenges and most forward-thinking projects.

SAP Unified Analytics for Concur (UAC) is SAP Concur’s new data and analytics solution scheduled to launch later this year. This solution will be the replacement product to the current Cognos-based solution, Intelligence. The release of this new solution is an integral step in advancing SAP’s Intelligent Enterprise and technical guidelines for all analytics solutions to be based on the use of SAP Analytics Cloud.

SAP Concur’s 2023 product vision consists of the following three pillars:
  • One Effortless T&E Experience
ONE fully integrated solution across the entirety of the travel planning-to-reimburse process, with ONE effortless customer experience.
  • Spend Management Automation
AI & ML leveraged to automate spend management and eliminate expense reports entirely.
  • Integrated, Sophisticated Data & Analytics
Data and analytics integrated into every product, every feature, and every decision

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP Concur iXp Intern- Data and Analytics
Location: Bellevue, Washington (Virtual)
Expected start date to end date: June 2021 -August 2021

In this role, you’ll:
This summer, we are looking for an intern to work on helping us lay out the plans for how we can deliver on the third pillar of Integrated and Sophisticated Data & Analytics. Specifically, we are looking for an intern that can deliver a plan including the following:
1. Integration points into other SAP Concur products with specific focus on Expense, Invoice. Travel, Request, and Verify
2. Use cases for each integration point
3. Mock-ups of what the customer experience would look like for the customer

Who you are:
Our continued growth is dependent upon talented people with a variety of skills, knowledge and backgrounds. We hire Strategic Product Managers- Data & Analytics interns with experience in all of the following areas:
  • Graduate student in Computer Science or Business Administration
  • Familiarity with data and analytics and the travel industry is a definite plus
  • Self-motivated and inquisitive– the eagerness to learn, the desire to get the job done and the curiosity to ask all the questions to uncover information needed
  • Logical thinking – understanding starting points and laying out what needs to be done to get to the end point
  • Strong presentation skills – the ability to articulate the problem and proposed resolution that is clear and persuasive
WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

Full Job Description

Software Engineering Intern

Peeva is seeking a Software Engineering Intern for this paid internship to permanent hire position. All the fundamentals are in place to help this person succeed: cutting-edge technology and products.

Education - Masters Graduate in Computer Science from an accredited University

The Software Engineering Internship is the prerequisite for a Software Engineering Position. This is a paid internship leading to a potential full-time hire position. Your title will be Software Engineering Intern, however, you will be in a highly visible role reporting to the Company’s CEO, and Chief Technical Advisor. Your performance will have a material impact on the overall corporate success of Peeva’s growth.

In this role, you will be the “bridge” between the high-level company vision and direction and execution of the day-to-day engineering efforts that deliver on the vision. You will learn, grow, and ensure the delivery of our existing software products and work on future product releases if you so choose.

Skills required:

Best practices in Scalable Software Development, Manage unit tests, system tests, and regression tests, estimate work units, work within the swim lanes of our agile development process and how to be part of a team.

Key Responsibilities

Your technical acumen will be utilized from day 1 where you will first be brought up to speed with our existing frameworks, stack, and the overall database design. You will be required and heavily relied upon to trouble shoot, deflect, and altogether prevent any hiccups from occurring. This is actually a fun job with autonomy, established trust, and open minds that seek out creative suggestions.

  • Peeva is a company is here to provide what you make of it, albeit you want to work off Jira Tickets or carve your own niche by contributing within a permanent long term position to assist with the management and motivation of multiple cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality releases on schedule
  • Once you accept our full time offer, you will help grow the engineering staff by hiring quality software engineers that match the culture and that can quickly contribute to our corporate goals, ensure clear and objective communication of goals, responsibilities, and timelines between all stakeholders, both internal and external
  • Formulate and measure long-term objectives and standards of performance for the department and individual engineers
  • Assist in the management of local, remote, and outsourced resources, including hiring and managing, and facilitating the rapid, effective and quality growth and utilization of the engineering staff that interacts with customers to learn about new requirements and opportunities and to articulate the value and best practices of our products

Qualifications

Software product management

  • Experience with enterprise class cloud-based end-user applications targeted at Fortune 1,000 companies is crucial.
  • Proven success in translating business requirements into product
  • Proven success in translating business requirements into product plans
  • Experience with and a commitment to Agile development methodologies
  • Ability to motivate and inspire others through collaboration and influence
  • Strong relationship management, strategy development, project management, problem-solving and change management skills
  • Committed to the highest standards of excellence and integrity

Requirements:

Masters graduate with a keen passion towards Software Development (Application Security, Information Security, Network Security) and Networks.

Technical Skills:

Programming: Java - Core, Spring, and other frameworks | Web Services | Bash | .NET Core 2 or later with C# | Entity Framework | Identity Server 4 | Ionic 4 or later | Microsoft SQL Server Web

| HTML | CSS | JS |

Tools/API : Proficiency in working with Amazon Web Services offered tools.

| Confidentiality ( AES, 3-DES, RSA ) | Integrity ( SHA-1, SHA-2, MD5 ) |

Full Job Description
AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of small molecule and biologic prescription medicines. AstraZeneca is pioneering innovative research and exploring novel pathways across key therapeutic areas, including respiratory, inflammation and autoimmunity; cardiovascular and metabolic disease; oncology; neuroscience; and infection and vaccines.

We are currently seeking candidates who are working towards obtaining a Bachelor degree in Biology, Statistics Computer Sciences or related field for an internship during the summer of 2021.

Objectives/Goals of the Position:
The position will provide an undergraduate interested in pursuing a career in the biopharmaceutical industry with an opportunity to gain knowledge of and experience with applied statistical methods and software automation in a commercial biologics operations organization

Primary Duties:
The intern will work with the GTO statistics team and local IT to develop web-based statistical tools to automate routine statistical analyses (e.g., analytical method validation, comparability, and other applications) with the goal of streamlining projects in the AZ BioOps Network.

Position Requirements:
Rising college students pursuing Bacholor or Masters degree in Biology, Statistics Computer Sciences or related field
Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0+

Required Skills:
Knowledge of undergraduate-level statistical methods
Proficiency in statistical programming using SAS and/or R, front-end experience with Spotfire a plus

Full Job Description
AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of small molecule and biologic prescription medicines. AstraZeneca is pioneering innovative research and exploring novel pathways across key therapeutic areas, including respiratory, inflammation and autoimmunity; cardiovascular and metabolic disease; oncology; neuroscience; and infection and vaccines.

We are currently seeking strongly motivated candidates who are working towards obtaining a MS, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or related fields for an internship during the summer of 2021.

Intern will work on his/her own data science related projects, under the guidance of our senior scientists to perform relevant data science or quantitative research.

Intern will also gain an insight into the leading biotech pharmaceutical company and learn by using machine learning and data modeling how to accelerate the drug manufacturing process in biopharmaceutical development.

Core Responsibilities:
Solve data science related drug manufacturing problems through modeling & simulation.
Data preparation and pipeline development.
Develop machine learning models for upstream/downstream drug manufacturing process to facilitate efficient decision making for process optimization.
Literature review.

Technical Skills:
Programming (Python/R), statistics, data modeling, experience with supervised learning (regression/classification), decision trees, signal processing, neural networks.
Data preparation, understanding of Cloud computing, APIs, familiarity with databases.
Critical thinking, problem solving and strong communication skills.

Full Job Description

DVSport, Inc. is a software company based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania specializing in digital video acquisition, analysis, and playback software designed specifically for the sports market. With over 2,350 systems deployed, DVSport has a strong customer base that spans the professional, intercollegiate and high school sports market. Additionally, DVSport is the industry leader in HD Instant Replay solutions for professional and collegiate sports. DVSport is leading the way in developing innovative digital video solutions at all levels of competition for all sports and delivers proven solutions that have become the standard by which sports-related digital video analysis systems are measured. DVSport customers use their custom-designed software products on a daily basis to scout, analyze, review, and teach.

This technical production internship would be in our corporate production headquarters and will work with our technical production team in a hands on and fast paced environment.

Your Role:

-Work under senior production team members to assist with the development, assembly, support, testing, and deployment of technical equipment and hardware that is used by our clients in the field.

- Assist with inventory management controls and documentation.

- Work with the shipping department on hardware deployment and returns and condition assessments.

What you bring to the game:

-Currently majoring in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, related IT or Engineering discipline preferred.

-Demonstrate working understanding and knowledge of the IT field including but not limited to hardware and software.

-Sharp mathematics skills.

-Working familiarity with electronic components and maintenance of components.

-Capable of working independently as well as with a team.

-Strong and demonstrated leadership abilities.

-Ability to work under and meet deadlines.

-Strong communication skills.

-Commitment to customer service and meeting and exceeding customer expectations.

-Must have a valid driver’s license.

-Ability to lift objects upwards of 50 lbs.

position: Summer STEM Teachers, Assistants, Internship (Minecraft, Coding & Robotics)
description:
Full Job Description

Hello, and thank you for your interest in our Summer Technology Teacher and Assistant Positions! Below is an overview of the program and positions as well as a few questions to help us determine if you are a good fit for our company.

***** APPLY ONLINE https://forms.gle/HcBgnimNwyi7nJVa7 ***************

************************
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
************************

You must be available for 8 weeks this summer from June 8 to August 7. Classes typically run Monday-Thursday with occasional Fridays, and you will need to be available from 8 am to 5 pm. Some classes run in only the morning or just the afternoon, and sometimes both.

As a Teacher or Assistant, you will be driving to your site, typically a school or community education building. You will typically be responsible for bringing 2-3 plastic bins of equipment per class, which you will then be set up in a classroom before students arrive. You will need vehicle to transport class equipment. Our headquarter location is in Roseville, Minnesota. You will need to go every 1 to 3 weeks to our headquarters for training and equipment pick up and drop off.

Rochester and St. Cloud teachers will only need to go twice in one summer

You will be delivering our curriculum to classes of up to 18 students. Teachers must be comfortable with managing up to 12 students alone. Grade level will vary between K-8th grades depending on the class.

************************
ABOUT PROGRAM:
************************
Tech Academy teaches week-long technology classes throughout the US. We offer classes in Minecraft, Movie Making, Video Game Design, Legos, and Robotics for students ages 6-14. We are seeking enthusiastic applicants for our Summer Camp Technology Teacher and Assistant positions.

Ideal applicants for Teacher positions are college students/graduates with experience with elementary-age children or licensed teachers.

Ideal applicants for Assistant positions are tech-savvy high school or college students, or those qualified for the Lead Teacher position looking for a more relaxed role in the classroom.

Many of our past employees were able to use position to satisfy an internship requirement from school.

************************
Training and Equipment:
************************
Before teaching or assisting, teachers must complete 12 hours of online training on basic camp management and leadership skills. You must also complete an in house 12-hour employee orientation.

The curriculum will be provided to each teacher for each class. You are required to go over the curriculum, and submit projects to us prior to teaching. We will available during business hours via phone and email to help you. You will be provided all of the equipment needed to teach a class each week.

************************
Pay:
************************
Teachers: $14-$20 an hour
Assistants $12-$14 an hour
Prep and training: $10 an hour

************************
Requirements:
************************
-College Student/Graduate majoring in Engineering, Computer Science, Graphic or Visual Arts, Video Game Design or Education
-Experience with Elementary age children
-Have a valid driver’s license
-You will be required to complete a local and national background check
-Be very comfortable with technology and using computers
-Your own reliable vehicle that can transport up to 4 large plastic totes
-Able to lift equipment totes weighing up to 40 pounds
-You must be very punctual and reliable. Students must always be supervised.
-You must be organized and efficient to run an effective class
-You must be self-confident, energetic, creative, and assertive enough to control a class of high energy elementary-age kids
-You need to be able to work independently and communicate via email and phone with us on a regular basis
Reliable access to the Internet and a cell phone.

Plusses:
Knowledge of Legos, Minecraft, or both Programming or Robotics experience of any kind

******** APPLY ONLINE https://forms.gle/HcBgnimNwyi7nJVa7 ***************

Full Job Description
Company Description

RockCreek is a leading global investment management firm that applies data-driven technology and innovation to sustainable investing. With over $15 billion in assets under management, our portfolio managers construct multi-asset class global portfolios and customized technology solutions for a sophisticated investor base that includes endowments, foundations, pension plans, and sovereign funds. We are focused on the integration of environmental, social and governance (ESG) and sustainable impact across portfolios to generate long-term returns. RockCreek has a culture of diversity and debate, and a relentless drive to excel.

As one of the largest women and minority-owned asset managers globally, RockCreek values diversity and inclusion across the firm. Building on our role as a leading allocator to women-owned and diverse investment managers, RockCreek pushes the industry forward by recruiting team members from all walks of life. People from diverse backgrounds represented over 85% of RockCreek’s 2020 Summer Analyst Program and 47% identified as women. Our own Management Team and Advisory Board is more than 80% and 70% diverse, respectively. To date, RockCreek has invested over $6.4 billion in diverse investment funds and companies. We welcome and support team members across different immigration and socio-economic experiences.

Job Description

RockCreek offers a unique perspective into the world of finance and investing, facilitating learning and growth. RockCreek is looking for graduate and undergraduate students who are interested in finance, have a desire to acquire hands-on experience, and are comfortable working in a flat, tight-knit team environment. Doors are always open for you to ask questions and explore opportunities. Successful candidates are entrepreneurial and capable of working well under pressure.

RockCreek Summer Analysts are graduate and undergraduate students who will:

  • Work with a diverse team to overcome challenges at an institutional asset management firm
  • Receive personalized mentorship from senior partners and analysts at RockCreek
  • Apply critical thinking and solid communications skills to analyze investment opportunities both qualitatively and quantitatively
  • Train on Bloomberg Terminals, up your Excel game, and gain technical expertise
  • Immerse yourself in global markets and macroeconomic news flows to identify the next big thing
Want to learn more about the RockCreek Summer Analyst Program? Visit our website at:

https://therockcreekgroup.com/rockcreek-internships/

Qualifications

  • Interest in investing, financial markets, global economics, ESG, impact, climate-related investing, and geopolitics
  • Positive, team-oriented approach to analytical projects and problem solving
  • A familiarity with the principles of computer science – including coding, programming and visualization
  • A strong academic record with a well-rounded set of extra-curricular activities and experiences
  • Ability to succeed in a remote setting dependent upon the trajectory of COVID-19
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Delaware STEAM Academy is seeking part-time Scratch coding, Python, Unity and Machine Learning coaches to teach students computer science and Rapberry Pi for Grades 2-12 Online.

Coaches will present developed and tested curriculum in Scratch, Micro.bit, Raspberry pi, Python, JavaScript, Unity, and Machine Learning. Course training is provided but instructors are encouraged to share their knowledge and experience. The right candidate will have the ability to create rapport with a young audience to develop their curiosity of how things work, motivate their critical thinking ability and develop problem-solving skills. We are looking for an energetic individual with an engaging personality who believes in our philosophy of learning and innovating in a fun environment.

This opportunity is for our leaders of tomorrow who want to share the passion they have for their career choice.

Future STEM graduates: Take this opportunity to pass the torch, influence the next generation, and further develop your transferable career skills.

Future teachers: Take advantage of the opportunity to work with different grade levels, help you decide your preference, and further develop your classroom management skills.

To give students and parents support during the COVID-19 pandemic, we are providing online STEM + Coding and AI Machine Learning programs.

At a regular school year, we visit different schools or centers to teach. Classes are held 3:00–5:30 p.m. Monday through Friday and 10:00 a.m.–4:00 p.m. on Saturday and Sunday.

Hours are flexible and based on scheduled classes and instructor availability. Each class is typically led by a lead coach with 8-12 students.

Requirements

· Passion for working with young people and guiding them in exploration

· Punctual and reliable

· Comfortable with Python and other computer languages (Java, JavaScript, C#)

· Confident, energetic, and assertive enough to control a class of high-energy young kids

· General knowledge of programming language

· Driver’s license and reliable automobile with clean driving record (ability to safely transport supplies in multiple large bins)

· Able to pass a background check (includes FBI fingerprinting and child abuse record check)

For more information please visit: www.desteam.org

description:
Full Job Description
Title: Fall 2021 Intern - Machine Learning Engineer

Company: Samsung Research America (SRA)

Lab: Think Tank Team

Location: Mountain View, CA

Lab Summary:
The Think Tank Team is an interdisciplinary collective of researchers, designers, scientists, and engineers located in Mountain View, CA, and representing a diverse skill set including electrical engineering, computer engineering, signal processing, machine learning, computer vision, visual design, interaction design, industrial design, optics, physics, and more. We work and play as we create Samsung's future products, encompassing a unique mix of research with a diverse and dynamic approach to early product development. As a team, we have a strong track record of driving concepts to production, we work on a wide variety of time scales, advancing science to working technology, developing new or improved product designs, and creating new experiences.

We believe that design and creativity are the core duties of every member of our team. We are creating products that will impact the lives of how millions do what they do, but better. If you want to create and build new devices and technologies, can learn on the fly, delve deep into solving complex problems as you work closely with others, and creatively approach design and engineering tasks at all scales, then we invite you to apply.

See some of our work at http://thinktankteam.info/

Position Summary

We are looking for a problem solver with a positive mentality to get things done. A strong background and interest in machine learning and computer vision who is not afraid to dig beyond the libraries and learn the math behind if needed. Interest in working across different computing platforms (embedded, smartphones, desktops, cloud, etc.) and passionate about a wide range of areas: cameras, health, FoodTech, robots, etc.

Requirements

B.S./M.S./Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Math, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience with
novel publication record in a variety of areas
Understanding current state-of-the-art literature in vision/learning while bringing your experience and intuition to develop next-generation products and experiences
Strong C++ and/or Python skills
Ability to rapidly prototype using leading ML/DL/CV frameworks and libraries such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, Torch,
Scikit-Learn, Scipy, and others
Experience in building novel custom features and pre-processing approaches to improve baseline algorithms
Experience in real-world scenarios, beyond using standard libraries and class projects

Responsibilities

Participate in groundbreaking research in machine intelligence and machine learning applications
Leverage expertise from ML research and develop novel predictive models/algorithms on new datasets
Develop solutions and algorithms that can be applied in real-world applications and devices
Work closely with researchers and engineers from subject areas to develop new algorithms, product concepts, and core-technologies that will bring new business opportunities to Samsung

If this is something you would love to do, let us know.
Show us what you have built, and tell us what you would like to build next!

Samsung is committed to encouraging a diverse workplace and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Full Job Description
Business Group Highlights

Defense

The Defense group supports the Department of Defense (DoD) mission to keep our homeland and its citizens safe. We provide solutions to improve the Nation's defense by providing software, systems engineering, IT, training and logistics and fleet management solutions.

Responsibilities

The Perspecta Summer Internship Program offers students an opportunity to gain hands-on work experience while building knowledge and skills in fundamental aspects of the cyber mission. Take charge of your professional development and experience a once-in-a-lifetime internship opportunity.

How would you like to spend your summer developing technological solutions that contribute to the security of our nation? Does the prospect of applying your skills to the Cyber and Cyberspace mission spark your interest? If so, then join a team of highly skilled, motivated and passionate professionals who help lead and shape the cyber battlespace, and who are ready and prepared for the challenges that threaten our freedom. The Perspecta Summer Internship Program offers students an opportunity to gain hands-on work experience while building knowledge and skills in fundamental aspects of the cyber mission. Take charge of your professional development and experience a once-in-a-lifetime internship opportunity. At Perspecta we see a better way. Imagine. Innovate. Achieve.

Intern supports the ARCYBER Program Management Office in direct support of the On-boarding, Mandatory Training, and Training Compliance Program.

Tasks include:
1. Project Initiation - The student will be exposed to the relevant "client" information that would be typically collected during the onboarding process, initial mandatory training, and tracking of continued training compliance. The student will develop and wireframe a website / digital experience to meet the Program Manager’s expectations to include Hierarchy Mapping. The on-boarding process will include modules for: Account creation; CAC activation, time and attendance, and employee benefits.

2. Website Development - The student will design and build a website based on their Hierarchy Mapping developed in Step 1 that leverages industry best practices to ensure page speed and matches the "client's" design criteria. The student will use a combination of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP to create an engaging and functionally sound web experience.

3. Revisions and Updates - The student will assess and respond to "client" revisions to meet the clients needs while maintaining the original structure of the site. The student will repeat this process until they receive final approval.

4. On-Site Optimization - The student will learn and employ on-page optimizations for both page speed and search engine optimization. The student will configure server caching and alternative image rendering processes to create a sub 2 second page load. The student will also learn the basics of the Google Search Engine algorithm and optimize content and headings to help promote better search results across all search engines.

5. Analytics and Tracking- The student will configure and implement a variety of user tracking and session tracking analytics codes, as well as complete testing to ensure all codes are firing appropriately.

This internship program results in the student becoming accustomed to the entire development cycle of a small-medium sized business website, and is designed to prepare the student for all technical aspects of the development process. The student will learn each component of these tasks from an expert in a wide variety of live environments, and then employ what they learned for their primary internship project.

At the end of the internship the student should have the ability to create, host, and manage dynamic and responsive websites that meet industry security, speed, and search engine standards.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule
  • Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level.
  • Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays.
  • Participation in company-wide extracurricular programs.
  • Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Augusta, GA, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket.
Qualifications

  • Must be a U.S. citizen.
  • Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance.
  • A GPA of 3.0 minimum, 3.5 or higher is preferred.
  • Must be currently enrolled in a degree-seeking college or university program with at least one semester remaining following the internship. Or, for those students about to graduate from one-degree program, it is necessary to clearly state future plans demonstrating continued academic pursuits in the term immediately following the internship.
  • Must provide transcripts covering academic qualifications described above.
  • While the major focus of the Perspecta Georgia Summer Intern Program is toward STEM degree programs in Computer Science, Engineering, or Cyber Security, other degree fields will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
  • Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of January 2021 and March 2021.
For Colorado Residents

About Perspecta

What matters to our nation, is what matters to us. At Perspecta, everything we do, from conducting innovative research to cultivating strong relationships, supports one imperative: ensuring that your work succeeds. Our company was formed to bring a broad array of capabilities to all parts of the public sector—from investigative services and IT strategy to systems work and next-generation engineering.

Our promise is simple: never stop solving our nation’s most complex challenges. And with a workforce of approximately 14,000, more than 48 percent of which is cleared, we have been trusted to do just that, as a partner of choice across the entire sector.

Perspecta is an AA/EEO Employer - All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

As a government contractor, Perspecta abides by the following provision

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of the other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c).

position: Data Scientist Intern (PhD Preferred, Open to Master)
description:
Full Job Description
Overview

**This position is intended for students in a degree-seeking program, to which they will return at the end of the summer internship in 2021. If you do not meet this minimum criteria, please revisit our careers site for other opportunities.**

Want to apply your technical skills and innovative ideas on top of the collective financial data of 40+ million consumers and small businesses, and help build data products (in TurboTax, Quickbooks and Mint) that solve real-world customer problems and power prosperity around the world?

Intuit is seeking Data Science Interns to join us this Summer (2021). Working side-by-side with Intuit's Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers – along with Data Analysts, Software Engineers, and product managers – you will help us understand and improve customer experiences with our products by uncovering critical insights and developing machine learning models.

What you'll bring
Must be currently enrolled in a degree seeking program and return to school after internship is complete (PhD preferred, open to Masters)
Major in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research or other quantitative field
Familiar with machine learning techniques (regression, classification, clustering, optimization, etc) and understand their mathematical foundations
Ability to explore, discover and import data from multiple sources and make them machine learning ready
Design and test hypotheses about causes and cures
Strong programming skills (Python and Scala preferred)
Excellent communication skills and ability to learn fast
Experience in developing machine learning solutions to solve real-world problems is a plus

Published works in top tier data science and machine learning conferences such as KDD, ICML, NIPS, ICLR, ACL, SIGIR, WWW, CVPR, SIGMOD, etc. is a plus
How you will lead

Times series forecasting
Image/document understanding
Intent classification
NLP/NLU/NLG
Conversational UI, Chatbots
Personalization and recommendation
Deep learning
Semi-supervised learning
ML services (autoML, feature recommendation, explainable AI, etc)

Adversarial Deep Learning ranking algorithms for question-answer forums
Use topic modeling to link form lines to verbose instruction/publication documents
Patch based information extraction using an unsupervised form segmentation algorithm
Assess agent call quality using call transcript data
Apply deep learning for transaction time series forecasting with uncertainty estimation
Explore active learning to improve the event labels used to train our supervised models
Predict cognitive biases using financial data

position: Research Engineer Intern, Computational Imaging & Graphics (PhD)
description:
Full Job Description
The Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) Research Team brings together a world-class team of researchers, developers, and engineers to create the future of AR and VR, which together will become as universal and essential as smartphones and personal computers are today. These roles are focused on developing computational imaging and graphics methods that deliver quality and performance improvements within a virtual reality graphics pipeline. In particular we welcome PhD students in computer science, electrical engineering, physics, or similar, with a strong background in prototyping 3D graphics, imaging, or sensing.Our internships are twelve (12) to sixteen (16) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year.
Develop next-generation head-mounted display prototypes.
Explore the application of computational imaging methods to virtual reality, emphasizing the development of advanced algorithms, simulations, and hardware capabilities.
Collaborate with the larger Oculus team and provide creative leadership on computational imaging and graphics technologies.
Prototype the algorithms on mobile processors.
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD degree in the field of Computer Science, Optical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics, or a related field.
Ability in algorithm development for 3D graphics, displays, cameras, or other optical sensing devices, as demonstrated by publications, internship, work experience, coding competitions, class work, or contributions in open source repositories (e.g Github).
1+ years experience with solving graphics problems or inverse problems in imaging emphasizing modeling, algorithm development, and hardware prototyping.
2+ years experience programming in C or C++.
Interpersonal skills: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration.
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op.
Experience with OpenGL/Vulkan, and/or OpenCL/CUDA.
Experience with machine learning based image-space graphics or computer vision techniques, specifically ones that are real-time or especially performant. (relighting, segmentation, depth estimation, etc).
Experience in VR related research.
Experience in developing algorithms on compute constrained platforms such as mobile SoCs.
Demonstrated experience via an internship, work experience, or widely used contributions to open source projects.
Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by first-authored publications (e.g., SIGGRAPH/Eurographics, CVPR/ICCV/ECCV, Optics Express, etc.).
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Safran Aerospace Composites (SAC) is a subsidiary of Safran Aircraft Engines responsible for the manufacturing of composites parts for Safran's LEAP engine. We are hiring an intern to join our engineering teams in our San Francisco office. At Quantcast, data is king, and we know how to process it. As the real-time pulse of the Internet, Quantcast runs the world’s largest AI-driven insights and measurement platform directly quantifying over 100 million web destinations.

We are using machine learning to drive human learning. Quantcast provides brand marketers and publishers with significant audience insights, predictive targeting and measurement solutions across the customer journey.We do this at scale. Our typical day consists of dealing with 200+ billion transactions a day at 4M QPS at peak.

As a Software Engineer Intern, you’ll seek significant answers related to operating such a Software Platform at scale - Low-Latency, High-Scale Software Architectures; Machine Learning; Distributed Storage Systems; Big Data platforms; API Development and Data Visualization.

You’ll have the opportunity to learn Software Engineering methodologies and will own projects from start to finish. You are passionate about building scalable backend systems and customer-facing applications. You will thrive in an environment where independent decision-making based on product requirements is the norm. We foster an agile environment where new ideas and software development come together to optimally pursue some of our industry's toughest problems.

You will provide technical solutions to take on exciting problems in the advertising industry
You will partner with a team of engineers and work on a variety of large scale systems

You will gain exposure to existing Quantcast systems and our technologies to internal and external customers

BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field (Graduation date before August 2021)
Excellent command of one or more programming language such as Java, GoLang or Python
Experience working on projects involving distributed systems, big data and large-scale systems
Deep understanding of algorithms and data structuresGood command over verbal and written interpersonal skills
Quantcast is an audience intelligence and measurement company headquartered in San Francisco. Combining machine learning, a privacy-by-design approach, and live data drawn from more than 100 million online destinations, Quantcast provides software, information and advertising services for marketers, publishers and advertising agencies worldwide. Founded in 2006, Quantcast has employees in 20 offices across 10 countries.

Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 277891
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

Software Developer UI

We are looking for passionate and experienced developers to be part of a high-performing and motivated team, working in SAP Hana & Analytics - Data Intelligence team at the La Crosse, WI office.

Our team has the mission to design and develop massively scalable, multi-tenant aware solutions and applications to address Enterprise Data Management problems including Metadata Management and Data Quality. Enterprise data is often siloed in applications, preventing customers and software vendors to harness its full value. As a leading cloud software company, SAP is in a unique position to harness the treasure of data in the various SAP and non-SAP sources and catalog, prepare and enrich this data for analytics. SAP’s Data Intelligence application will provide a unified solution to connect, discover, orchestrate, and manage both internal and external data assets.

The solutions we build also comprise a set of automated services to provide and consume data assets holistically. The development will be driven across our teams in Walldorf, Germany; Palo Alto & La Crosse, US; Istanbul, Turkey; Brazil, China, India, and others.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Working as part of the team in La Crosse, WI, you will be joining experienced, driven, and entrepreneurial colleagues to develop enterprise ready software. Your role will span ideation, architecture, design and implementation of services and applications in the HANA & Analytics space. You will help pave the way for our customers to quickly unlock cloud-scale innovation with the complex landscapes they have today. We are building ground-up new products to drive innovation across complex business systems that already exist at customer’s sites as well as drive cross-sell of our cloud portfolio.

We are looking for a technically strong developer with great soft skills including a team-oriented nature, flexibility, agility, great communication skills and the ability to deal with diverse personality types and work styles.

QUALIFICATIONS

BS or MS in Computer science or related fields
UI app development skills with programming languages like HTML5, CSS, UI5 and frameworks like Angular, React.
Solid foundation in computer science with strong competencies in Data structures, Algorithms, & Microservices
Programming skills for development in TypeScript, JavaScript, Java
Experience with building and deploying services in AWS, Azure and Google Cloud will be an added advantage
Experience with container-based technologies like Kubernetes & Docker
Strong inter-personal, communication and presentation skills

WORK EXPERIENCE

Experience in software development with the above-mentioned competencies: 0-2 years. New graduates will be considered.
Experience working in an agile environment, DevOps, and alignment with corporate Software Development Lifecycle
Self-motivated, self-driven, curious, open minded, resourceful and flexible with the ability to learn quickly

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Full Job Description
Ramp is building the modern financial stack that enables companies to accelerate growth without compromising on their finances. We’re on a mission to uncover and eliminate waste before it can undermine our customer’s goals and make financial rigor easy by enabling real-time visibility and understanding of every dollar spent. Ramp was founded by the same team who built, scaled, and sold Paribus to Capital One, enabling automated savings on online purchases and putting over $100 million back in consumers’ pockets every year. We are backed by Founders Fund, Coatue, and Box Group, and more than 50 founders of leading companies.

About the Role

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?

Collaborative, creative, inclusive, and fun team environment

Security Clearance

LLNL is a Department of Energy (DOE) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Laboratory. Most positions will require a DOE L or Q clearance (please reference Security Clearance requirement). If you are selected, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. In addition, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. An L or Q clearance requires U.S. citizenship. If you hold multiple citizenships (U.S. and another country), you may be required to renounce your non-U.S. citizenship before a DOE L or Q clearance will be processed/granted. For additional information please see DOE Order 472.2.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please submit a request via our online form.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

Full Job Description
GRAIL is a healthcare company whose mission is to detect cancer early, when it can be cured. GRAIL is focused on alleviating the global burden of cancer by developing pioneering technology to detect and identify multiple deadly cancer types early. The company is using the power of next-generation sequencing, population-scale clinical studies, and state-of-the-art computer science and data science to enhance the scientific understanding of cancer biology, and to develop its multi-cancer early detection blood test. GRAIL is headquartered in Menlo Park, CA with locations in Washington, D.C., North Carolina, and the United Kingdom. It is supported by leading global investors and pharmaceutical, technology, and healthcare companies. For more information, please visit www.grail.com.

This summer intern position will be part of the Bioinformatics and Data Science (BXDS) team working at the interface of our one-of-a kind DNA methylation-based dataset of >10,000 cell-free DNA samples, world-class cloud computing infrastructure, and unparalleled curated clinical data to discover novel biological insights into the detection of early stage cancer. You will be trained in the development of methods, analysis, pipelines, and algorithms of next-generation sequencing data, for cancer detection, conformant to CLIA guidelines. You will enjoy life in the San Francisco Bay Area, activities with other summer interns, and start-up company culture.

You Will:
Work on complex computational problems requiring exploratory data analysis, use of custom and existing bioinformatics tools, and application of various statistical and machine learning methods.
Find new solutions to open-ended problems through collaboration with software engineers, data scientists, and bench scientists.
Exercise judgment in defining methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
Translate findings into recommendations for the development of new products.

Possible areas of focus:
Apply machine learning methods to help model and interpret biological data, identify and validate genomic features driving tumor development.
Develop and implement new or existing tools for visualizing novel genomic datasets to help drive bioinformatics and data science efforts.

Your Background Includes:
Pursuing or recently completed a Masters or Ph.D. in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology or related field.
Previous Life Science or Machine Learning research experience.
Experience with programmatic workflows for manipulating, analyzing, and visualizing very large and disparate data sets.
Experienced with statistics as applied to the analysis of high-dimensional biological data and analytical study design.
Demonstrated understanding in at least one programming language (Java/C++, Go, Python, R,) and proficiency in Linux environment.

Bonus:
Knowledge of cloud technologies (such as AWS).
Experience with source control practices and tools (Perforce, Git, Arcanist, etc.).
Familiarity with TensorFlow.
Experience with R package + Shiny app development.

Full Job Description
About Foursquare:
Foursquare is the leading independent location technology company, powered by our deep understanding of how people move throughout the world. Our solutions help businesses make smarter decisions, developers create more engaging experiences, and brands build more effective marketing strategies.

Foursquare's platform includes Attribution, Audience, Pinpoint, Proximity, Places, Pilgrim SDK and Visits. As the industry's first and only accredited company for location data from the Media Rating Council (MRC), this foundation powers all our solutions — those that exist today and those we have yet to build. Over 14 billion consumer-verified place visit confirmations help us keep our map and models fresh and up-to-date, building a phone's-eye-view of the world with 105 million unique places of interest worldwide.

About our Engineering Team:
As a member of Foursquare's engineering team, you will gain experience building real products from the ground up. We're passionate about tackling tough challenges in the location space and look for others who like to dive deep into code and help solve hard problems.

Join us and help bring our feature ideas (and your own!) out of Slack and into reality. Here are some high-level areas you could contribute to:

Improve the accuracy and efficiency of one of the premier Place search APIs in existence. Our API powers Foursquare City Guide and Swarm as well as apps from Microsoft, Uber, Samsung, Twitter and more
Leverage machine learning techniques to build systems which process and derive insights from billions of location data points every day
Launch features that make cities easier to explore and continue to push the Foursquare City Guide and Swarm apps forward
Build resilient services and tooling which process petabytes of data and implement cutting edge machine learning techniques
Build scalable infrastructure to support rapidly growing products with enterprise level reliability requirements

Qualifications:
Currently, a rising Junior or Senior pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
Solid foundation in computer science fundamentals with sound knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and design

Bonus points for any of the following:
Development experience in any of the programming languages we use: Java, Scala, Obj-C, Kotlin, Swift, Javascript or Python
Mobile development experience on iOS or Android
Experience applying ML techniques
Experience developing Yarn applications like Hadoop MapReduce or Spark

Foursquare is proud to foster an inclusive environment that is free from discrimination. We strongly believe in order to build the best products, we need a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds. This leads to a more delightful experience for our users and team members. We value listening to every voice and we encourage everyone to come be a part of building a company and products we love.

Foursquare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description
Why Intern at Health Care Service Corporation?

Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), a Mutual Legal Reserve Company and an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. HCSC affiliates and subsidiaries such as Dearborn National®, TMG Health and Medecision, offer group life, disability and dental solutions, as well as a range of other individual solutions. The company, founded in 1936, serves nearly 15 million members across five states and employs more than 21,000 people in over 60 local offices. HCSC is dedicated to expanding access to high quality, cost effective health care and equipping our members with information and tools so they can make the best health care decisions for themselves and their families. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. Today, we are leaders in the development of value-based care models to spur greater collaboration and accountability among various stakeholders to improve the health care experience for patients and consumers and enable them lead healthier lives.

This ten-week paid internship is located in Richardson, TX

What Are Your Responsibilities?
– Support the development of a comprehensive analytics-driven operations monitoring strategy
– Conduct data mining and analysis to test controls and address key business risk
– Support data visualization and dashboard development for executive level stakeholders
– Participate in a data-oriented and growth-focused team environment

What Do You Need To Be Successful?
– Passion for analytics, problem solving, and process improvement
– Basic knowledge of SQL and relational databases; SQL, Python, R coding a plus
– Familiarity with data visualization tools, such as Tableau and Power BI
– Exceptional attention to detail and quality
– Ability to self-motivate, remain organized, and receive direction well
– Team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills
– Practical, developed PC skills, especially Excel, Word, and Access

What Are the Requirements You Must Meet?
– Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in data science, computer science, business analytics or related field
– Graduation date between December 2021 – June 2022
– A minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0
– Availability to work 10 weeks during the summer
– Unrestricted authorization to work in the United States

What Does the Internship Program Entail?
– Formal Intern Orientation to build business and industry acumen
– Challenging real-world hands-on project
– Weekly networking opportunities among interns and company leaders
– Professional development workshops
– Business Resource Group involvement
– Volunteer activities

HCSC is committed to diversity in the workplace and to providing equal opportunity and affirmative action to employees and applicants. We are an Equal Opportunity Employment / Affirmative Action employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug-free and smoke-free workplace. Drug screening and background investigation are required, as allowed by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Requirements:
Expertise Analytics & Reporting

Location TX - Richardson

Full Job Description
AVANGRID, an innovative and growing energy company, needs a creative and ambitious college student to join our Integrated System Planning team. You will take part in an Internship program to learn our business inside and out. If you are looking to broaden your skills sets and learn more about careers in energy, apply today. For more information on our company, visit www.avangrid.com.

As part of our program, you will develop, test and troubleshoot web applications and commercial off-the shelf software (COTS) for the Integrated System Planning team. The ideal candidate is flexible, passionate, creative and enjoys taking on new challenges.

Here’s what you’ll do:
Participate in a dynamic internship program where you’ll work on several projects within the Integrated System Planning team that may focus on Investment Planning, Load Forecast, Network Modelling and Hosting Capacity.
Work with Distribution Planners on the Integrated System Planning team using COTS to develop solutions and learn about the energy industry.
Work in an innovative and energized environment with a chance to make an impact.
Create a comprehensive presentation of your work completed during the program for presentation to the wider organization at the end of the program.

Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field.
Option to participate in the AVANGRID Mentoring Program.
Exposure to all aspects of the business through business briefs hosted by AVANGRID senior leaders.
Opportunities to develop leadership capabilities with leadership development resources.
Opportunities to network and build lasting relationships with great colleagues from across the globe.
A focus on innovation and technology.
A commitment to the environment and providing clean, renewable energy.

Skills & Abilities:
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Self-motivated and able to work independently
Ability and desire to work in a team environment & learn quickly
Creative and innovative thinking
Ability to learn quickly

Experience with .NET Core, C# and/or Python
Experience with SQL Server and writing queries
A strong desire to learn and contribute
Able to communicate effectively and collaborate with remote team members

Self-motivated and able to work independently

Baidu Research General AI team (GAIT) is looking for an outstanding intern with strong background in computer vision, machine learning, and deep learning. Our mission is to research and develop next generation artificial intelligence (AI) technologies for image and video understanding as well as related products in cloud, intelligent cameras and robots. As an intern at Baidu, you will be uniquely positioned in our team to work on different industry problems and to push forward frontiers of AI technologies. Publications in premier conferences or journals are also highly encouraged.

PhD student in Computer Science, EE, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.
Strong publication record in premier AI-related venues such as CVPR, ICCV, ICLR, NIPS, PAMI, TIP, or other related major conferences or journals.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Team player with good communication skills.
Strong coding skill with Python, CUDA, C/C++ and so on.

Culture Fit:
Mission alignment: If you want to be part of a team to accomplish this great mission, we will provide you the best possible platform to do that.
Self-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?
Hungry to learn: We are eager to see you learn new skills and grow. But learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.
Team orientation: We work in small, fast-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other and go after big goals together as a team.

Full Job Description
Overview

How would you like to work in a place where your contributions and ideas are valued? A place where you can serve with compassion, pursue excellence and honor every voice? At Wellstar, our mission is simple, yet powerful: to enhance the health and well-being of every person we serve. We are proud to have become a shining example of what's possible when the brightest professionals dedicate themselves to making a difference in the healthcare industry, and in people's lives.

Responsibilities

The IT Student Intern is a student-level position for hands-on training and development in the WellStar IT environment. Personnel in this position are expected to complete a 12 to 16-month internship program to be considered as a candidate for an extern-level position in their department area of interest, or another position on the IT team. This is a supervised role responsible for identifying growth and development of the student, as well as creating innovative solutions to our department. This role serves as an analytical/functional specialist and works independently with guidance in group activities, projects and events. This role is instrumental in understanding the fundamental basics of healthcare IT with its core curriculum, building of their professional style and creating a network foundation for future growth. This role will work with seven IT areas, six fundamental departments for development and growth, and the seventh department as their career focus with the intent to further expand their knowledge, profession al growth and skillset, all the areas in a 12 to 16-month period.

Qualifications

Required Minimum Education:
Enrolled in college in their 4th or 6th year of their Bachelors or Masters Degree in Information Technology and/or health information related degrees with a minimum of 70% of credit hours completed for undergraduate degrees

Required Minimum Certification:
none

Required Minimum Experience:
none

Required Minimum Skills:
As a member of the Information Technology (IT) Customer Services group, the IT Student intern’s responsibilities include:

Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office: Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint
Self-starter with proven abilities in organizational, conceptual, and logical problem solving
Ability to manage assignments that are of diverse scope and complexity and require initiative and judgement
Enroll in basic principles of each IT areas with the department’s sponsoring manager every 30 days
Effective phone email and excellent communication skills; excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal skills
Provide support to certain IT department while developing knowledge by shadowing or hands on troubleshooting with limited access
Capable of working independently and with groups
Contribute ideas, creative thinking and suggestion with team members
Flexibility to work in different departments based on need

We’d like to invite you on a career journey like no other! In return for your contributions, we’ll help you make the most of all life’s moments – on and off the job. Wellstar Total Rewards is designed to provide for your total well-being, including: Your Wellness, Your Pay, Your Future, Your Joy. We think it’s pretty simple – we care for our team members and our team members care for the community.

Make a difference in patients’ lives… and your own! Here, it’s more than healthcare – it’s CareerCare!
